Travels New Zealand 2009 Gillespies Beach (19th of November, 2009)

Gillespies Beach (19th of November, 2009)

Gillespies Beach is a location where dredge mining was attempted and there is lots of little walks around there showing the remanents of a failed enterprise. We also walked across to another Beach where there was a seal colony, much greenstone and a waterfall

  • Miners graveyard
  • Beach sheep rocking the car park
  • The end of Gillespies Beach before we started to walk inland
  • At the end of the tunnel that led to nowhere was a lookout point
  • Seal colony at Galways Beach had many seals who were deeply suspicious of us
  • Kim could not resist playing in the waterfall at Galways Beach
